name: Dario Argento's cult classic horror film
reviewBody: Suspiria is a cult classic by Italian horror maestro Dario Argento. American student Jessica Harper arrives at a German dance academy in a raging thunderstorm. The headmistress - Joan Bennett - is a little more than weird. The school is full of young girls and Jessica begins to notice strange things and hear strange sounds. What's really going on at the school? Some flying bats and falling maggots later she finds out after she does some detective work. Directed by Argento in a jarringly abrasive style, Suspiria has gaudy sets and a strange irritating musical score by "The Goblins." Suspiria has its creepy moments and the barbed wire scene is especially disturbing. You won't fall asleep during this film.
